objectives: Use common classifier handshapes (CL:1, CL:3, CL:V, CL:B) to show movement and placement
Layer classifiers with time/place anchors and clear transitions
Maintain role clarity: narrator-neutral vs. character RS while classifiers animate the scene

vocab.def: Single index to show a person moving/standing.
Two fingers for falling, sitting, landing.
Palm to indicate floor/table/road/wall; supports contact.
Arc/line showing motion; bounce/tap to show impact.
Switch from neutral narrator to character POV briefly, then return.

sections.heading: 1) Warm-Up: Place + Path

media.alt: Classifier path arrows over a road surface
media.caption: Anchor the surface first, then move on it.

sections.body: Set **CL:B ROAD** (flat surface). Move **CL:3 CAR** straight, turn-left, stop. Then add **CL:1 PERSON** crossing. Keep each path **clean + single idea**.

sections.heading: 2) Model: Short Action Beat

media.alt: Narrator shows car turning, biker swerving
media.caption: Neutral narrator ‚Üí RS ‚Üí neutral return

sections.body:
Example gloss:
‚Ä¢ **YESTERDAY AFTERNOON STREET (CL:B). CAR (CL:3) DRIVE, TURN-LEFT, STOP.**  
‚Ä¢ **BIKE (CL:3-small) SPEED, SWERVE (avoid).**  
‚Ä¢ **RS‚ÜíBIKER:** **WORRY FACE.** (neutral)  
‚Ä¢ **SAFE FINISH.**

sections.heading: 3) Technique: Clean Layers
sections.body: Order for clarity: **Surface ‚Üí Object ‚Üí Path ‚Üí Contact/Result**. Avoid mixing many paths at once. Use **tiny pauses** between beats. Return to **neutral narrator** before RS.

sections.heading: 4) Partner Drill: 3 Beats, 2 Classifiers

media.alt: Two signers practicing sequential action beats
media.caption: Beat1 ‚Üí Beat2 ‚Üí Beat3

sections.body: A tells three quick beats using at least **two classifiers** (e.g., CL:3 vehicle + CL:1 person). B identifies each path and result. Swap roles.

sections.heading: 5) Mini-Showcase
sections.body: Record **30‚Äì40s**: build an action scene with **one surface**, **two moving things (two classifier types)**, and **one contact/near-miss**. Include **one RS** line and return to neutral.
sections.teacherNote: Assess for clean surfaces, uncluttered paths, and obvious result (stop, bump, avoid).

items.q: Which classifier represents a vehicle best?
When should you return to neutral narrator?
Gloss a two-beat action: car turns to avoid a walker (use CL:3 and CL:1 + a surface).

items.prompt: Which part was hardest‚Äîclean paths, contact markers, or RS timing? What‚Äôs your plan to improve?

summary: You used surfaces and common classifiers to animate action scenes, kept role clarity with neutral returns, and showed results (stop/avoid/impact) cleanly.
